name: Kepler-345
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-345 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-345 is a star with 0.5199999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.62 times its radius. It is located 1182.19 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-345 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-345 b

Kepler-345 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-345.

The mass of Kepler-345 b is 0.47 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-345 b is 0.74 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-345 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-345 c

Kepler-345 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.39 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-345.

The mass of Kepler-345 c is 1.49 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-345 c is 1.2 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-345 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-345, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
